description:
I find this side of the Marina is pretty scarce on restaurants. I'm really glad Kui Shin Bo is one of the few we do have. Their prices are great for Japanese food and they have a giant menu. 

I find this place is perfect when you don't want to cook, have picky family members, or are just too tired to walk to the main drags on Chestnut or Union. 

The food is solid. They have some interesting stuff like seafood tempura or squid tempura and these Japanese cabbage pizza things, which I can't remember the name of right now. 

Every time we have ordered to go, the food has been hot and our order correct. When we eat in, the service is always great and the restaurant is very clean. 

Definitely will continue to be a convenient favorite for my family.
author: Mitch C.

description:
I read the reviews before coming here so I wasn't expecting anything great. I feel really bad for the reviewer who said this was the best place she ate when she visited SF :/ Because if this was the best place you ate in SF, you seriously messed up. 

We got some sushi and some ramen. Both were just ok, and per my 2 star rating, I've definitely experienced much better at similar prices.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
This little restaurant was the best place we ate during our trip to San Francisco. We listened to reviews and ordered the black garlic ramen- and it was absolutely incredible! It had the perfect amount of spice. We also ordered the deep fried California roll, the negihama roll, and the volcano roll, which were all delicious. I particularly recommend the deep fried California roll for the price. 

We ended up going to this place 2 times during our short trip, and it was relatively inexpensive, delicious food. Loved this place.
author: Nicole V.

description: Average Japanese and Sushi Restaurant in downtown San Francisco. The waiter who took our order was nice but I noticed upon entering the restaurant that he was eating with his hands and didn't wash them before he came to take our order. He also stepped out of the restaurant to smoke and still didn't wash his hands when he came back. It would have been a great dining experience
author: Maria I.

description:
The food here is terrible. A poor imitation of Japanese food. The foreigners seems to like it. Look elsewhere of you're looking for authenticity.

They try to use quantity to make up for an apparent lack of quality. Massive bowls of ramen with no flavor.

The okonomiyaki lacks flavor as well. These people have no idea what real Japanese food taste like.

It was so bad we didn't finish our food. Out looking for pizza now. 

Avoid at all cost.
author: Dominic C.

description: Japantown sushi place!!! Our first time here. The service was good n treated us with Alle with humble heart!!! The kind of place I love taking Alle too. The ramen soup was AMAZING. There was wait for sushi that's why I give them 4 star.
author: Abby S.

description:
This is a nice little sushi spot on Lombard and overall their sushi is fresh and tasty. Beware, their menu is huge and it took forever to decide!

I tried the vegetable croque, California roll, volcano roll, tempura, karaage curry, and the assorted sushi. The vegetable croque and tempura were fried perfectly and were solid appetizers. 

The California roll with real crab was good but the volcano roll combines all my favorites: crab, tuna, salmon and shrimp tempura. The karaage is not as good as other places and their curry is a bit milder with less flavor. 

I did enjoy their nigiri/sashimi and if you're a fan of sushi that's what you come here for. The assorted sushi came with 6 different nigiri pieces and also a tuna and a cucumber roll. 

Service was just okay, they didn't really check up on us without asking them for anything. For some reason the rolls came super late after I had already finished my sushi. 

The seating space is limited so expect to come here with a party of 4 or less. Prices are moderate and what you'd expect to pay for high quality sushi. 

Would I come back? Maybe. It's a solid sushi spot in the neighborhood and there's so much to try on the menu. 

Food: 4.25/5
Value: 3.5/5
Service: 3.25/5
Overall: 3.75/5
author: Brian G.

description: Great little place! Friendly and fast service! Definitely recommend! Price was very reasonable for the area and actually much lower than I was expecting!
author: Ashley D.

description:
I came here looking for ramen while on a business trip. I'll be visiting Japan soon and have been becoming more aware of different types of Japanese dishes that I want to try. This place has a huge variety of authentic Japanese food and I wish I could have tried more of them.

I ordered grilled beef skewers (forget the name) and tonkotsu ramen. The ramen was tasty, good noodles and broth. Pork was just OK. Beef skewers were delicious. 

I'd come back if I'm in the area again.
author: Mandy M.

description: I was amazed by the quality of the fish here. Having worked in the sushi industry before I have experience with fish and the selection here is absolutely fantastic. Not to mention for a great price. I got the sashimi and sushi combo which includes 3 pieces of nigiri, a full California roll, and 9 pieces of sashimi all for 20 bucks. Talk about a deal. This would easily be 50 dollars anywhere else. I highly recommend this sushi bar for all sushi enthusiasts.
author: Michael O.

description: We were craving ramen last night and originally went to a place in Union square but the line was way too long and it was super cold outside so we yelped this place and decided to come here instead because it was fairly close to our hotel. We were seated right away upon coming in here & quickly placed our orders. We ordered the spicy ramen and the curry beef ramen. The service itself was not bad but it literally took us about an hour for us to receive our food. I think my ramen cane after about 40 minutes and we waited an additional 20 minutes for my bf's udon to come out. By that time I was already done eating when his food arrived to the table. Both dishes were okay; pretty mediocre. But I don't think I would want to come back here because I don't want to wait that long for my food especially if I'm hungry.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Well we went here off the good reviews.  Ordered our food. Was advised one of the items takes long "no problem we said" figuring all the rest of our food would come out first.  We waited and waited nothing. Couple next to us ordered another order of gyoza and got before we even got our first order of gyoza.  Ok will let that slide. But then we just kept waiting and waiting. Finally got my warm not hot ramen. Asked for no green onions or bean sprouts got them both. Looked like they tried scooping out the bean sprouts after realizing was suppose to be none.  Gyoza was good, ramen would have been better nice and hot. My friends food he said was good, his wife NEVER got her food NEVER. We finally asked and the guy was like "oh it was the lady, I can get for you."  We said no it had already been over an hour. Table next to us heard us asking for our missing food so they asked about their missing item, same issue. Our server was this lady came from car parked on the street. The whole time I was convinced she didn't actually work there. She didn't have the red shirt uniform and she left before we even finished. Haha maybe she didn't really work there.  Giving it 2 stars cause the food we did have was ok. Would have been 5 stars had my friends meal come and had they been a little more attentive.
author: Wam M.

description: They are very polite and friendly. Their food were so delicious. 5 star for that. Myst try this if you guys planning to go to the Lombart Zigzag road. .
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Just got the Tonkotsu ramen from here and was pleased at how good it was. Noodles were par for ramen and the broth was good. Service was decent and we came at a time where we were the only people in there so it was pretty chill. Worth a stop if you are nearby and craving ramen!
author: Robert R.

description:
Visited today as part of the soft opening.

My boyfriend and I arrived around 6pm.  The restaurant was fairly empty and we were seated right away.

First impression - the menu is huge. I'm thrilled to have this new restaurant around the corner from my house.

We went ahead and ordered the veggie okonomiyaki, tonkatsu ramen w/medium spice (boyfriend), and black garlic ramen w/medium spice (me). Food took about 10-15 minutes to arrive, with the ramens arriving first. 

The ramen was good. The broth was creamy and just heavy enough to put you in a food coma, but not make you feel sick from eating too much. The flavor was perfect and the medium spice was just enough (and I like hot stuff!). The garlic ramen wasn't too garlicky so that it overpowered the tonkatsu flavor. The meat was a bit fatty for my preference, but everyone likes their meat different, so I can rate based on that. (5/5)

The okonomiyaki was great! I probably will order a meat or seafood version next time, but the veggie was good too. It really reminded me of my time in Japan, very authentic flavors. (5/5)

Now the reason I am only giving 4 stars is because there are a few things the restaurant needs to improve if they want to thrive in the Marina/Cow Hollow:
1. Atmosphere is definitely lacking - someone else mentioned this in their review as well. The lighting is too bright (go buy some softer light bulbs... cheap easy fix).
2. Restaurant is too quiet and lonely - definitely need a sound system with music. We are in the Marina after all. This is a must!
3. Upgrade the water glasses to glass, not the tacky plastic ones. 

That being said, I think the food and prices here are just right and I hope these don't change. At this price point, I could become a regular. 

I look forward to trying other food on the menu... especially the sushi!
author: Amanda R.

description:
A bit on the smaller side in terms of size of the restaurant but had no problems getting a seats for dinner on a Wednesday.

Got two rolls (Rock N Roll and Spider Roll), agedashi tofu, and one tsukemen for two people.
Everything is good/standard. We had leftovers and pricewise, pretty affordable.

Definitely will come back since it's within walking distance of my place! Kinda get the feeling (since there were a lot of pick up) that this is a good place to order and go.

Experience was good and service was friendly.
author: Mimi T.

description: This is quite possibly one of the worst food experiences I have ever had.  This isn't authentic Japanese so don't be fooled!  Whatever I was served was beyond disgusting.  It was as if someone microwaved a sauce and then slopped it onto some steamed noodles.  Our orders also came out at separate times (microwaved much?).  Please don't let this happen to you too...avoid this at all costs.  There is much better food for similar costs a few streets away.
author: Paige M.

description: I found this restuarant on Yelp. Great resturant! While eating there, I found lots of take out orders that means one thing... locals like this resturant so it must be good.
author: Tanveer R.

description:
Basic as fuck. 

Their location in Japantown is a million light years ahead. Like, how are these places even related?

Décor screams dollarstore fire sale and the menu is nothing groundbreaking. 

But the service. 

Man, it sucked.

It was like my being there was a bother. What's worse is that the guy serving looked to be the owner. LOL

Beware if some chubby Asian guy with greasy hair, wearing an ill-fitting leather jacket named 'Kevin' serves you.
author: Andrew C.

description: Wow, this place is legit. This unassuming little place on Lombard-- where tourism can be high and expectations can be low-- is a serious contender to any high-end, highly-overpriced sushi I've had in the city. Noodle and ramen dishes also look legit, though haven't tried yet. Will be back.
author: Lauren B.

description:
We ordered Black Garlic Ramen (spicy) and Mad Spicy Ramen. The portion was big and both were so delicious. They were the best ramen we ever tried. 
We ordered H15 sushi and it was also delicious. Overall a really good place. Their service is very friendly as well
author: Yorie P.

description:
For all the Japanese food places this one was awsome.

Just in passing without looking up the place saw it off the side of the street aftet looking at Golden Gate Bridge.

Just like other comments below Kevin the owner was on point.  Always ready to get your order as fast as possible.

Sake was great.
Undo wad great.
Hamachi was awsome.

Oh yeah liked tile design on bathroom walls in back.

Hidden in the hills of Lombard st.  In San Fransico.  

They have take out service too.
author: John S.

description: This place is awesome i  the black garlic ramen, Customer service was excellent as well.
author: Antoine O.

description: AMAZING ramen!!! Super quick service - we were seated right away and our food was brought out as soon as it was ready! The staff was attentive and kind! I will definitely be back!!!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Walked in at 945pm and we were hopeful they would be able to accommodate an order to go, and they so kindly obliged. 

The food was delicious.  As always we like to try a few things on the menu to get a sampling. 

I ordered the Grilled Chilean Sea Bass. So delicious. (If you don't like fresh garlic, you may want to let them know because it's finished with it) I personally loved it. Freshly prepared and served with rice, salad and a little side of corn, carrot and broccoli.

Hubby ordered the Beef Teriyaki and it was equally delicious. He also tried the rainbow sushi burrito and it was filled with plenty of sashimi, and tempura shrimp. 

We asked the owner for a suggestion for a popular spicy roll that included raw or cooked fish.  He recommended the Volcano roll and it was awesome.  Yummy flavor in everything we ate.  We will
Be back
author: Del S.

description: Horrible food I came in for lunch. Mind you I was very hungry and I ordered deep fried California roll, veg tempura ,gyoza chicken ,shrimp tempura and special yaki all the meats was rubbery and it was disgusting I was soo hungry I only ate my noodles and anything that didn't have meat! I was very disappointed  spent over 70 dollars for some noodles and veggies! Never again!
author: Salvador P.

description: Had lunch there today. I was so happy to find it near our hotel. We ordered the Chicken Teriyaki, Vegetable Tempura, and Crispy Fried Tofu. All of it was delicious. Even my daughter who dislikes tofu ate it and liked it.
author: Rosie P.

description: Very accommodating place. We were a fairly large party and they were able to provide quick service to everybody.
author: Archie K.

description: 10/10 would come back here, very affordable and fresh sushi. I got a sushiritto and loved it! The service is extremely fast and the venue was clean. Super convenient when you need a quick bite and are craving sushi!
author: Nicole P.

description:
We were the only customers there when we arrived so we had great service obviously. We chose two of the Chefs Specials Sushis. Super Dynamite with caviar, tempura was tasty and just spicy enough while the super king roll was refreshingly simple. 

The two rolls of 8 to 10 pieces were enough to fill us up for around 30$. Definatly worth it.
author: Nicolas B.

description: This place was delicious. A must save on Google maps for next time that i am in the area
author: Noe V.

description:
We are regulars at their Japantown location so we were extremely excited when we heard that they were opening this additional location on Lombard!  This is one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco and we usually take our visiting friends and family here as well.  We've never had a bad meal here, the consistency after all these years is mind blowing.  The atmosphere is cozy and the family that runs the restaurant is amazingly sweet and friendly!  

We usually get the 2 item combo, for $9.99 and it comes with rice, miso soup, and salad!!!  Probably one of the best values in an overpriced city like San Francisco.  You can pick from about 20 items on the special menu.  I usually get the Wakame Udon and the Tonkatsu or the Kaki Fry (fried oysters).  Not sure what they put in their udon, but the broth is so simple and clean yet amazingly tasty, very very addictive.  They're very generous on the portions as well.  My wife loves the Vegetable Tempura and the Takoyaki.  We usually get the Spider Roll as well, but tonight we went commando and tried the fried soft shell crab ($6.99) by itself for the first time and HOLY CRAP it was pretty epic.  

The Japantown location can get a little busy with a waiting list during peak dinner time, even on a weekday so it's awesome that they now have this second location.  This location is about twice the size of the Japantown location and it looks beautiful inside.  You can tell they put a lot of pride and effort in decorating this location.  The food is still of the same high caliber and the service is as sweet as the Japantown location!  

We highly recommend Kui Shin Bo, I'm pretty sure when the word gets out about this new location they'll probably have a waiting list as well, so go try it NOW!!!!!!
author: Incognito S.

description: Brought my five month year old son in the completely took car of us. Minced some avocado for my son with out even asking. Ramen and the Philadelphia roll was awesome. Sapporo nice and cold
author: Kevin R.

description:
The rice was off, the himachi was off. The edamame was suppose to be spicy and only a few had some of the spice Sprinkles on them. I ordered the cucumber roll and well  then a caterpillar roll and  my favorite sushi place was closed so I came here. It didn't look fresh as I wanted.... oh well 50$ dinner ... to top it off I got a parking ticket :l
It's metered parking. However I did go downstairs and get some tasty ice cream. I tried to make the best of it. I won't be coming back :l how do you mess up rice as a sushi restaurant I'm still sad about it lol
author: Krystal L.

description:
Was really craving soup on a cold SF night so decided to try out the ramen here and was not disappointed. This was truly some of the best ramen I've had in SF. I ordered the black garlic ramen extra spicy - so good. There were so many flavors and the broth was to die for. The pork instead was a little tough but honestly the broth was so delicious that it didn't matter. 

I ordered only ordered takeout but the restaurant looked cute and is much bigger than it seems from the outside. Their location is a bit unfortunate though, not much foot traffic. I've lived in the Marina for a long time and had no idea it was here until specifically looking for a place close to him. 

I spoke with who I believe is the owner, who was so kind and friendly. Will definitely be coming back for the ramen, and want to try out their sushi too.
author: Tatiana A.

description: Came here with my daughter for lunch. First timers wanting a sushi fix! Everyone was so friendly! We ordered Super Dynamite Roll, Salmon Mango Roll, and Gyzoa/ Spicy Garlic Edamame for appetizers. Both rolls were really good! Wanted to try their Beef Shabu because I love Shabu. I'll be back to try it!
author: Charlotte G.

description: If you want good sushi, this is the place. Great flavor and great prices. I know this sounds tacky but my food tasted like it was made with love! We had the tongue appetizer, yummy yummy. We had a rock n roll, rainbow roll, baked scallop roll and 1 other one I dont remember the name of but, they were above and beyond what I expected. It's a small, hole in the wall place so dont come here looking for fancy. Just great food!
author: Yessy M.

description: Before we left for our trip to San Francisco I had yelped and bookmarked different places I wanted to try. Come to find out this one was literally right next door to our hotel. We loved this place so much we went here for dinner 2 nights in a row (and probably would've went more if we could've).  Service is awesome, food is awesome. Will def be going back on our next trip... only wish it was closer to us :)
author: Carolyn H.

description:
We stumbled upon this jewel while staying in a hotel up the road. We really wanted ramen, and didn't feel like venturing out too far, as we had spent the whole day driving. 
We were surprised that they offered sushi as well as ramen, and ordered both. 
Hubby had the miso ramen, which he enjoyed, as well as the real crab meat California rolls. They were the best he's ever had he claimed. 
I had the black garlic ramen, which definitely satisfied my craving for the night. A nice broth not too thick or salty, it hit the spot. 
While chatting with a Kevin, the owner, we found out he serves sushi burritos, we are anxious too try those, but being so full from our generous portions of food, we told him we would be back to try them.
Nice cosy spot, with a welcoming staff. We will definitely return.
author: Michelle T.

description: Love love  this place! Every visit  is an adventure.I choose a soup that is the most delicious and fills my belly!
author: Teresa J.

description:
This is a take out order review.
Ordered the Nigiri Combo on 10/18/2017

Worst sushi I've had in SF. 
Problem 1: The fish looks terrible. The color for classics like salmon and maguro looks really off color and waxy. This means the fish is old or they are not even okay quality. 

Problem 2: The fish is cut so thin that I could only taste the rice when I had the nigiri. What's the point of paying for fish if I can't even taste them? 

Most overpriced Nigiri I've had, especially as I was paying only for the rice.
author: Andy C.

description: Had dinner here with a group of friends on a Saturday night and had no problems getting a table. Unfortunately all the food came out at different times and service was so slow that half the table was done eating while the other half were still waiting for their food an hour after we were seated. It seemed like they were cooking each order one at a time and a dinner that probably should have only been an hour to an hour and a half went on to be over two hours due to the wait. I had the black garlic ramen which was ok. The noodles weren't chewy which is the texture I prefer but I liked the broth and the meat was also nice and tender. I would say 3 stars for food but minus one for the long wait for food.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Ordered take out here their sushi platter on Christmas Eve. Order came on time and it was delicious and also a great hit at the party!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Okay but not much service or hospitality 
It was close but wouldn't return
Nothing more to say about the place
author: Ann S.

description: Love LOVE the miso ramen here! Huge menu and everything is delicious. The staff is also wonderful, the owner Kevin is always so kind. The Lombard location has a great spacious atmosphere. Truly my favorite ramen in SF!
author: Sophie S.

description: Came to SF on vacation and was looking for some good sushi near my hotel and came across this place. Glad i came here the sushi was so delicious, i had the volcano roll and the ramen. All was really good.
author: Cindy D.

description: Food is good but they prioritize to-go orders over actual in-house customers. Vegetarian options, most recommended is black garlic ramen. Good food but horrendously slow service. Just order pick up instead.
author: Ash L.

description:
In SF for the day and wanted to try out a new restaurant. We have eaten A LOT of sushi in many cities. Combining the service with the food quality, this place gets 2 stars. 

Food review (sushi only):
Caterpillar roll: We were put off by the entire roll being cold, I presume this meant that the eel was not freshly torched/grilled/cooked. The eel sauce was also not very good compared to most places we've had. 
Spicy tuna roll: Instead of the tuna being small pieces mixed with spices, this was regular, plain tuna inside the roll with a TON of spicy mayo covering the roll. My husband loves mayo and this was too much, even for him. 
Rainbow roll: We upgraded to real crab for an extra $2 and there was so much mayo in the crab mixture that I couldn't eat it. I had to pick all of it out to eat the remaining roll. There were a couple pieces of fish on top of this roll that had an odd texture and color so I opted not to eat those pieces at all.

Service: 
Extremely slow! There was only one other table of 3 seated in the entire restaurant and it took at least 30 minutes to get these three rolls, which came one by one. 
 
Overall I ate a few pieces of torn apart sushi that was about comparable to a supermarket sushi (Whole Foods sushi is better!). Would not go back.
author: D K.

description: Food was good but service wasn't so great. Had to keep raising hand to get attention of staff.
author: Kat P.

description: This place had great ramen my very first time trying it. Ordered the tonkotsu soup and my boyfriend order the black garlic ramen I'd highly recommend the tonkotsu! The only downside is the place is small, but the staff is friendly and the food was out quick.
author: Alicia P.

description: Their udon was surprisingly good. Chewy noodles, fresh vegetables, and solid broth. The sushi was pretty low quality though, so I wouldn't go here for the fish but rather the cooked food. Their menu is a bit too extensive and intimidating -- makes it seem like their food will be average across the board. Bonus points for being it being a family-run business and the people being nice.
author: Young Y.

description:
Not Japanese owned. Rolls were ok nothing special. Warning for those ordering Nigiri : there's a lot of rice on the bottom and little fish on the top. Tasted more like grocery store nigiri. 

Service was ok. Place was small but they had seating for our large table when we got there.  The manager seemed annoyed when we asked for things. Since we had a large party they automatically added the tip. That's fine but when we got the bill, they had the tip percentages listed for you to fill in. Not a good way of doing business. I can see tourists from other countries giving them an additional tip from the tip they already included.
author: Neil K.

description: This is one of those sushi spots that serves substantially more rice than actual raw fish in the nigiri and rolls. Reasonably priced and fish quality is not bad, but service is very poor. I went during their soft opening and decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and went again to see if service levels changed...unfortunately not.
author: Alex B.

description: Great spot to pop into after a trek up lombard street/ impeccable service, very clean fast and decently priced. Ordered a tofu sushi burrito and a seafood hotpot- both were delicious
author: Grace L.

description: New spot that is open during lunch and dinner. They have an assortment of sushi, rolls, teriyakis, udon, ramen and even sukiyaki and Shabu (you don't cook yourself however). Prices are reasonable and service is friendly and good. Will be back soon!!
author: Natalie S.

description: We found this restaurant by way of Yelp and it did not disappoint. We made a reservation for a Saturday night at the Lombard St. location, but did not necessarily need it. There was plenty of seating around 7pm. This is a small place though, so if you have a larger group it may be worthwhile to call ahead. We were a group of 5 and we were seated in the very back which was great since it felt more like a private dining experience that way. We had edamame, sake, beer, miso soup, nigiri, sushi, ramen and fried bananas - everything was wonderful. The service was phenomenal as well. Our waiter was very attentive. We enjoyed him and he seemed to enjoy us as well. Would definitely go back!
author: K.A. S.

description: The food was amazing. The Sashimi Cucumber roll, which was so delicious and generous. You should definitely also try the Tori Nabe, a specialite of the place, and a gastronomy experience. The staff are welcoming! You should definitely try this place!
author: Tamar S.

description: Decent. There wasn't anything special about the sushi that I could taste and the servings were quite small. I also had some of the ramen which was so-so. The broth had good flavor but the rest of the ingredients were a bit bland.
author: Mike Y.

description: Stumbled across this new Japanese resto in my neighborhood while out and about one day. Was just getting food for one so ordered a Rainbow Burrito (salmon, tuna, tempura shrimp in an oh so trendy SF-style sushi burrito). Was delicious, will definitely be back. They have a varied menu with sushi, rolls, udon, ramen, rice bowls.
author: Anna B.

description: AMAZING!!! honestly, more creative and interesting dishes than more upscale places. My 24 yr old daughter and I have had sushi and Japanese food all over the world. It might be a couple blocks out if the way from japantown, but worth the trek. Seafood pancake was awe inspiring and the sushi was the absolute real deal! I will definitely be back! Ps- I never write yelp reviews...i just REALLY thought this place was special.
author: Abigail B.

description: We had an awesome dinner here last night. Their sushi is delicious and the owner is so nice. We had the joy of talking to him for a long time and we will be back! Also try their unfiltered cold sake in the pink bottle. It's the best tasting sake that I have ever had!!
author: Kathryn U.

description: Food was amazing! The service was even better. Love this place. Me and my son came to have dinner here and we had a nice time.
author: Eric G.

description:
Great place with refreshingly affordable options!!

That said, they also provided high end items too. 

While most Japanese restaurants specialize in ramen, sushi, etc. this one has literally everything.
author: Naseem A.

description:
Just Okay. This is just an another Japanese restaurant in town. It is very common (and little sad for me) in SF, in the city where generally Japanese population is rather scarce, true authenticity is alway a question. The name, Kui Shin Bo seems familiar as there is a chain of the same name restaurants in Koreatown in L.A. I supposed they are not associated but this is a casual place and nothing wrong with it but nothing standout, at lease for super my picky palate. 

The staff chowing the food while semi-serving is not a pretty sight. 
The parking can be tricky in this area.
author: K O.

description:
Weird, tiny location and atmosphere more like fast food including the printed menu. We've never been to their place in Japantown - so it's not on our radar from there. 

That said, we'd like to help any new business succeed and since this they are in a 'soft opening', here's a message to the owners before they "really" open:

* When people arrive, if you leave the menu on the table you have to then follow-up and ask if we want a drink? Have questions? Etc.

* The lights. Way too bright. A little atmosphere would be nice. 

We didn't stay to eat because after 10 minutes we just decided we might wait forever - we just didn't have confidence we were going to have a pleasant experience and wanted to at least get recognized beyond the menu on our table.
author: Dennis S.

description: Great new well priced Japanese restaurant in the Russian Hill/Marina area. I've been to the Japantown location before and this location is a lot more open and bright. Their ramen at the Japantown location is pretty tasty, but this time we went for the Dynamite Roll and a bowl of Soba with tempura. Both were very satisfying and I will definitely be returning again to get my ramen fix.
author: Kay K.

description: Was craving ramen and picked this place at random, and oh my god how happy I am that we did! AMAZING the ramen had sooooo much flavor!!! And my husband ordered the spicy beef yakisoba and that was just as good as the ramen! They have 4 levels of spicyness that you can ask for! The service was great everyone was so nice and the service was fast as well. Also very kid friendly brought my 4 little ones and they were very accommodating! :) definitely coming back!
author: Janet G.

description:
The food was way better than I had expected looking at the exterior of this unassuming restaurant. The selection is very extensive, almost too big. Personally, I think the ramen was better than the sushi. 

*** update from 8/18... we all got a little sick from eating the California roll with real crab meat (which also cost more). Stick with the ramen, avoid the sushi, or at least any crab meat. :(
author: Ashley N.

description: Great food and friendliest staff! Love this place and the new Lombard location.
author: Roxy H.

description: I tried their sushi rolls and ramen. sushi rolls were amazing. It is a little place on Lombard street and I wouldn't have noticed it if not for great Yelp reviews. So glad I went in!
author: Shruti K.

description: Wandered by and what a find! The garlic ramen was perfect, each component was flavorful and fresh. Kids had the rainbow burrito and loved it. Very fresh.
author: Beth S.

description:
Very mixed feelings about this place. I've been here four times because I can't make up my mind if I like it or not. I keep going back in the hope to find at least one good dish to make it my "usual", but no luck. If all you want is tempura and some sushi rolls then you may love it.

Pros: 

- Everything from the appetizer and grill menu is great. From croquettes to shisamo to enoki bacon rolls they're all good. Fresh and hot and not greasy if fried. 
- Sushi rolls have been fine
- Haven't had problems finding seating 
- Service is friendly and very nice
- Decent price for the area

Cons:

- Nothing from the rest of the menu is any good. I've had watery salads, bland gyudon, ramen with terrible broth, and curry with no flavor. They're essentially inedible and even at half the price I wouldn't get them again. 
- Service is SLOW. I've seen people walk out without even having received menus and 100% of the time I need to ask to order as well as the bill. Be prepared to wait. They do seem to be handling a lot of takeout and delivery orders so that may contribute to it. Overall it's probably faster to walk to another sushi place on Lombard once you factor in this waiting. 
- Food comes out whenever they feel like it. Get ready for your dining partners to have their main course before any appetizers come, and then everything else will come at once. This isn't a huge deal, but apps first and then entrees with a small gap between does wonders for the experience. 

I desperately wanted this place to be good but I don't think I'll be going back any time soon. The people running it are friendly and I hope these are just new restaurant hiccups. If they can fix the service issues and get the rest of the food up to even mediocre level I think it would be a great spot to eat.
author: Paul H.

description: Amazing food! Period. It needs to be higher on the list! Everything was delicious! We had three different Ramen dishes, the duck plate, and sushi. Every dish was delicious and all of the plates were cleaned. Definitely try it out!
author: David S.

description: My finance and I had an awesome dinner here this past Tuesday. Sushi is top notch, service is outstanding, and the owner is super nice! Recommend this place if your in the Marina District. Will most definitely be back!
author: Ron B.

description: I just happened to find this Asian fusion restaurant while staying at a nearby AirB&B on business. The ramen is one of the best I've ever had--you must try the Black Garlic--absolutely delicious!!
author: Lisa S.

description: Like some other customers have mentioned, completely off ratio of fish to rice. Didn't realize I was paying sushi prices for a bunch of balls of rice. Really hope they work on providing more value to their customers.
author: Kevin S.

description: Nice little secret in the neighborhood!! I originally came here for a sushi craving and found the menu to be so enticing I tried the pan fried noodles and ramen miso, both were excellent!! If you need to satisfy a variety of taste buds, this is the place to go, anything on the menu is excellent so you can't go wrong. The owner is very helpful as well, so don't be shy to ask questions :)
author: Leanne C.

description:
I don't normally eat in the same place twice when traveling because I like to try lots of stuff
We went here twice for ramen and once for carry out sushi in four days. 
The staff was great. The ramen was great the sushi was great
author: Matt M.

description: We found out about this place on yelp. Food was good. My 12 yr old said so. Place doesn't look like much on the outside from the road. But it is a nice establishment. Friendly staff too. I had spicy crunchy roll and my son had California roll and Shrimp Tempura.
author: Mila H.

description: This is a nice little new spot on Lombard st near van ness.  I came here for a late lunch today with my coworker for a quick bite to eat. The sushi was good and fresh.  The potstickers were really good as well. Everything was priced right. I love supported local family owned and operated spots.  Check them out, you won't be disappointed.
author: David S.

description: As an out-of-towner this is the best quality and quantity of sushi I've gotten for my money since I can remember. Wish I lived here just so I could frequent! People next to me had some hot sizzling dishes that looked and smelled great also. Staff was very kind, gave me directions as I was wandering around town lost.
author: Emily B.

description:
Went in for lunch. It was fairly empty except for another table. The place looks brand new and clean however the ambiance as a whole was definitely lacking. The two waitresses who were there were really loud and kept talking in their own language ( not Japanese ) and they didn't play any music. All I heard was them talking non stop and people walking upstairs. The insulation is pretty thin I suppose. It was also a really hot day and there was no ventilation. 

The food: ordered ramen which was overall pretty good. It was a good size portion and the broth was pretty flavorful.  My spoon was dirty though. They asked if I wanted medium spicy and I said sure which I usually love spice but this was a tad more than medium spicy. My char su pork was also slightly pink in some spots.  

Overall , it was an okay spot with room
For lots of improvement. I don't anticipate ever being back though. It was a really uncomfortable atmosphere to eat in and the dirty spoon is not appealing.
author: Nancy T.

description: Amazing service! We came here two days in a row. Phenomenal food and very friendly staff. We got the yakisoba special. I would highly recommend coming here!!
author: Matt P.

description: I've now been here 4 times. The first time was great and the food was delicious. But the other 3 times I came, this place was closed. Weird because the hours on their door and their yelp said they'd be open. The 3rd time I even made a reservation on yelp for dinner, only to show up and find it closed. UPDATE YOUR HOURS! (But the food is really good though)
author: Siiana A.

description: Food was good as it was made largely from scratch. Menu offers a good deal of diversity. That is their appeal and their challenge. Takes them a long time to cook and serve to their menu. All folks in our party of 4 ate at different times.  The last person ended up taking their food as carry out.
author: Michael N.

description: Great spot for Japanese in this part of the city with a really awesome menu. This is a second location from the original in Japantown and they do it all--- sushi, ramen, specialty plates, hot pot, etc. I would definitely recommend goving this place a shot and there is something for everyone. Big bowls of ramen at a really solid price and lots of great appetizers; tender meat dishes and generous cuts of fish on sushi. Ive been here a few times once I discovered it this past week and keep coming back to try something new!
author: Ryan S.

description: This my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, Ca it is amazing and the manager is very nice! I will definitely be back! The service is great compare to the other Asian restaurant!
author: Tichelle C.

description: Really happy they expanded to the Marina. It's nice to have a go to Japanese restaurant on this side of the city with these type of prices. Sushi and rolls are delicious, and solid ramen as well. Kevin's a great guy and the service was impeccable.
author: Michael L.

description:
Went there during the opening week. Their menu is huge, which can be a small danger sign in my mind.  It spans soups, sushi, cooked dishes, and other speciality plates.  
We ordered a Hamachi Kama, which is one of my favorite dishes.  Unfortunately, it was one of the worst I have had.  You can go to Nijiya Market in Japantown and put it under a broiler and get better.  The texture was just all off from what I normally get at a sushi joint.  
We may try it again because it is close to us, but the one in Japantown we went to we felt was better.
author: Matthew F.

description: So excited to have a solid ramen spot in the marina! I had the mad spicy ramen and my boyfriend had one of the udon noodle soups. Both were delicious. They are still in early stages of opening and don't yet have beer, which would have been delicious with my soup. The gyoza were also delicious! I'll be back for sure
author: Katie K.

description: Great food and vibe. Sashimi platter was amazing:)  Owned by mom and pop store. Service was a bit slow it took about 30-40 min after we put our 2 orders to get our food.
author: Dan N.

description: If u want delicious, fresh sushi and don't care about music or decor, just really fantastic food, this is your new sushi spot!. We had 5 people, 5 rolls (fav was the spicy crunchy roll ), hamachi collar, seaweed salad, root veggies, salmon capaccio, and more. May have us complementary dessert, crispy banana with mango ice cream. Everything was fresh, so tasty we didn't miss music or a fancy environment. Staff is friendly and attentive. Totally coming back!!!
author: kari b.

description: the staff helped us take order was rude. bad customer service. we spent 80dollars on that damn service . no more again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Christine Z.

description:
This is the best Japanese place in the neighborhood. It's in a super nondescript building on Lombard, but the service and food is great!

Prices are pretty similar to what you'd see elsewhere, but the food is much more authentic than other spots in the Marina.
author: Cal A.

description: The sushi here was really good. My boyfriend liked the chicken teriyaki. The guy working (think it was the owner) was really nice. I would have ordered more if they checked on us after we got our food but thats ok. Will be back to try the ramen and for more sushi! Only thing negative is its so bright in there for dinner time it sort of kills date night vibes.. but ill still be back.
author: Yumi T.

description: Very nice crew and friendly! I always customize my rolls ( many allergies) the guy was patience and get everything I wanted, very tasty defiantly will recommend this place to my friends, only one thing would be nice if they put music on the background.
author: Shavi A.

description: I had a lovely time there. It was a quaint place, with minimalist decor and no music, but it was made up more than enough by the quality of the food. While my family got many dishes with no complaints, I personally got the pork katsu with curry rice. The katsu was crispy and tender, cooked to perfection, the curry was sweet, and the rice balanced it all out.
author: Thomas T.

description: Visiting SF and we found the perfect sushi spot. Very fresh food. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting.
author: Sergio C.

description: Quality of food was average but service wasn't good and food took a very long time to get to our table. Kevin the co owner wasn't very polite and seemed hassled with our orders. The bathroom ran out of toilet roll and we had to let them know to replenish. The meal wasn't worth the price we paid  - won't go back.
author: Jeanne W.

description: Sushi is delicious espeically the spicy crunchy roll. Service is even better especially from Kevin who is a total delight!
author: Hunter G.
